Class Redistrictor

java.lang.Object
metrocs.redistricting.Redistrictor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class Redistrictor extends Object implements Serializable
A redistrictor attempts to determine a set of districts for a given region under specified constraints. Typical constraints may include: achieving a specified number of districts, achieving the same number of voters per district, creating intra-district parity by party, creating region-level parity by party, favoring a party at region-level. Most functionality is available via utility methods.
Version:
20250808.0
Author:
Dr. Jody Paul, MSU Denver CS Students

      public Redistrictor(Region theRegion)
      Establishes a specific region as associated with the redistrictor.
      Parameters:
      theRegion - region associated with this redistrictor
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the region is null

  • Method Details

    • region

      public Region region()
      Accesses this redistrictor's region.
      Returns:
      the region

    • generateDistricts

      public static HashSet<District> generateDistricts(Region theRegion, int numDistricts)
      Utility: Apply a generate-and-test algorithm to search for any feasible redistricting solution.
      Parameters:
      theRegion - the region to be redistricted
      numDistricts - the number of districts for the region; defaults to 1 if value is less-than or equal to 0
      Returns:
      a set of districts matching the parameters, if feasible; an empty set if no feasible solution is found.

    • generateDistrictsUsingSnake

      public static Set<District> generateDistrictsUsingSnake(Region theRegion, int numDistricts)
      Utility: Apply a "snaking" algorithm to search for a feasible redistricting solution. Note that contiguity for non rectangluar regions is not considered!
      Parameters:
      theRegion - the region to be redistricted
      numDistricts - the number of districts for the region; defaults to 1 if value is less-than or equal to 0
      Returns:
      a set of districts matching the parameters, if feasible; an empty set if no feasible solution is found.

    • allDistrictsOfSpecificSize

      public static Set<District> allDistrictsOfSpecificSize(Region theRegion, int districtSize)
      Utility: Generates all possible districts of the specified size from a given region. If the region is smaller than the specified size, then a single district is returned. Otherwise, a set is created that contains all districts of the specified size.
      Parameters:
      theRegion - the region
      districtSize - the size of the districts
      Returns:
      a set of all districts of the specified size

    • allDistrictsOfSpecificSizeIterator

      public static Iterator<District> allDistrictsOfSpecificSizeIterator(Region theRegion, int districtSize)
      Utility: Iterator over all districts of the specified size for a given region.
      Parameters:
      theRegion - the region
      districtSize - the size of the districts
      Returns:
      a set of all districts of the specified size
